description: uDOS Virtual World Locations - 80+ locations across 6 continents with timezone data

regions.asia_south: South Asia - India, Southeast Asia, Philippines

locations.name: Forest Clearing
locations.description: A sunlit clearing in an ancient forest. Tall pines surround the space, their needles carpeting the ground.

locations.name: Tokyo - Shibuya Crossing
locations.description: The world's busiest pedestrian crossing. Neon lights reflect off glass towers as thousands of people move through the intersection.

locations.name: Tokyo - Shinjuku District
locations.description: Tokyo's neon-drenched entertainment district. Restaurants, arcades, and bars pulse with electric energy.

locations.name: Tokyo - Tower District
locations.description: The iconic red tower dominates the skyline. Below, temples and modern gardens coexist in harmony.

locations.name: Tokyo - Asakusa Temple
locations.description: One of Tokyo's oldest temples. Incense smoke drifts past traditional red lanterns and wooden gates.

locations.name: Mount Fuji
locations.description: Japan's iconic snow-capped volcano and UNESCO World Heritage site. Visible for hundreds of kilometers on clear days.

locations.name: Hakone Hot Springs
locations.description: A resort town surrounded by hot springs and mountain views. Relaxation and natural beauty blend together.

locations.name: Yokohama Port
locations.description: Japan's second-largest city and major port. Modern ships dock alongside traditional warehouses.

locations.name: Seoul - Gangnam District
locations.description: South Korea's ultra-modern entertainment hub. Glass towers, shopping malls, and trendy nightlife dominate the landscape.

locations.name: Seoul - Namsan Tower
locations.description: Seoul's iconic communications tower standing atop a mountain. Panoramic city views from the observation deck.

locations.name: Seoul - Olympic Park
locations.description: Venue of the 1988 Summer Olympics. Modern sports facilities surrounded by beautiful gardens.

locations.name: Seoul - Myeongdong Shopping
locations.description: Seoul's busiest shopping district. Department stores, boutiques, and street food vendors fill the pedestrian streets.

locations.name: Bangkok - Grand Palace
locations.description: Thailand's most sacred Buddhist temple. Golden spires glisten under the tropical sun, surrounded by ornate walls.

locations.name: Bangkok - Floating Markets
locations.description: Ancient canals lined with wooden boats. Vendors sell fruits, vegetables, and souvenirs from traditional long-tail boats.

locations.name: Bangkok - Ratchaprasong Shopping
locations.description: Modern shopping district with skyscrapers and luxury brands. A perfect blend of old and new Thailand.

locations.name: Ayutthaya Ancient City
locations.description: Thailand's ancient capital from 1351-1767. Ruins of temples and palaces hint at past glory.

locations.name: Khao Yai National Park
locations.description: Thailand's oldest and most visited national park. Rainforest canopy towers above wildlife trails.

locations.name: Phuket Beach
locations.description: Thailand's largest island and premier beach destination. White sand beaches and turquoise waters attract tourists worldwide.

locations.name: Phi Phi Islands
locations.description: Dramatic limestone cliffs rise from crystal-clear waters. A paradise for divers and island hoppers.

locations.name: Krabi Rock Climbing
locations.description: Towering limestone formations jut from the jungle and sea. World-class rock climbing destination.

locations.name: Mumbai - Marine Drive
locations.description: India's glittering coastal city. Skyscrapers reflect in the Arabian Sea, street food vendors crowd the promenade.

locations.name: Mumbai - Gateway of India
locations.description: Mumbai's iconic monument overlooking the harbor. Built in 1924, it symbolizes India's independence.

locations.name: Mumbai - Dharavi Slums
locations.description: Asia's largest slum - a vibrant community of millions. Leather tanneries, pottery workshops, recycling centers.

locations.name: New York City
locations.description: The city that never sleeps. Towering skyscrapers, busy streets, and millions of stories intersect.

locations.name: Niagara Falls
locations.description: Thundering curtains of water cascade down massive cliffs. Mist rises in clouds, and the roar is deafening.

locations.name: Toronto - CN Tower
locations.description: Canada's largest city with an iconic needle-like tower. A cosmopolitan blend of cultures and architecture.

locations.name: Great Lakes Region
locations.description: Vast freshwater lakes bordered by forests. Shipping routes cross waters that seem like inland seas.

locations.name: Chicago - Willis Tower
locations.description: The Windy City's iconic black tower. Industrial heritage meets modern architecture on Lake Michigan.

locations.name: St. Louis - Gateway Arch
locations.description: The iconic Gateway to the West. A gleaming stainless steel arch symbolizes westward expansion.

locations.name: Memphis - Music City
locations.description: The birthplace of blues and rock and roll. Graceland mansion and Beale Street pulse with musical heritage.

locations.name: New Orleans - French Quarter
locations.description: Louisiana's mystical city. Jazz clubs, creole cuisine, and Spanish moss on oak trees create unique atmosphere.

locations.name: Louisiana Bayou
locations.description: Swampy wetlands teeming with wildlife. Cypress trees rise from murky waters, alligators bask on logs.

locations.name: Houston - Space Center
locations.description: Texas metropolis home to NASA Space Center. 'Mission Control' commands from here to distant worlds.

locations.name: London - Westminster
locations.description: Britain's capital and heart of empire. Historic monuments blend with modern cityscape along the Thames.

locations.name: Scottish Highlands
locations.description: Rugged mountains and windswept moorlands. Ancient castles perch on rocky outcrops amid mist.

locations.name: Swiss Alps
locations.description: Towering snow-covered peaks with pristine glaciers. Alpine chalets nestle in valleys far below.

locations.name: Mediterranean - Athens
locations.description: Birthplace of Western civilization. Ancient temples overlook wine-dark seas and olive-covered hills.

locations.name: Sydney - Opera House
locations.description: Australia's largest city gleams on turquoise waters. Opera house sails catch harbor light.

locations.name: Outback Desert
locations.description: Australia's red interior. Vast empty plains under burning sun, where ancient Aboriginal cultures thrive.

locations.name: Great Barrier Reef
locations.description: The world's largest coral ecosystem. Underwater gardens burst with colorful fish and living corals.

locations.name: Uluru - Ayers Rock
locations.description: The red monolith at the heart of Australia. Sacred to Aboriginal peoples, it glows at sunset.

locations.name: Low Earth Orbit
locations.description: Floating above Earth's atmosphere. The planet's blue oceans shimmer below, a view of irreplaceable beauty.

locations.name: Mars - Olympus Mons
locations.description: Standing on the solar system's largest volcano. Red dust stretches to the horizon beneath a butterscotch sky.

locations.name: Alpha Centauri
locations.description: A triple star system, our nearest stellar neighbor. Three suns dance in complex gravitational orbits.

locations.name: Sagittarius A*
locations.description: The supermassive black hole at our galaxy's heart. Gravity warps space and time itself around it.

locations.name: Andromeda Galaxy
locations.description: Our nearest large galactic neighbor, 2.5 million light-years away. A spiral galaxy spiraling towards us.
